par.text: Metallic lithium is used as an additive to alloys of aluminium, zinc and magnesium, improving their hardness and toughness, and as a catalyst in numerous chemical reactions. It is utilised in the manufacture of batteries. Lithium also has wide applications in nuclear engineering. One of its isotopes,
is employed in the preparation of tritium (T) - a hydrogen isotope. Lithium is also used as a coolant in high-temperature reactors.
